portabout.para: NetBSD/landisk is a port of NetBSD to the SH4 processor based NAS appliances by &IODATA;.
Its current status is that of an experimental port.

portinfo.portlinkitem: NetBSD/sh3 pages provide general information about NetBSD's ports to SuperH machines.

portnews.portnewsitem:
NetBSD was ported to LANDISK by &a.nonaka;.
NetBSD 4.0
will be the first release to include LANDISK support.

portsection.title: Supported System Models
portsection.para:
The following appliances by &IODATA; are supported by the NetBSD/landisk port:
USL-5P (Japan) HDL-U, HDL-AV, HDL-W and HDLM-U series (Japan) SuperTank LAN Tank (SOTO-HDLWU) (Japan) UHDL-160U and UHDL-300U (May be found in USA)

Compatible systems from other manufacturers include
Plextor PX-EH16L, PX-EH25L and PX-EH40L
&IODATA; HDL-G Giga LANDISK is an ARM based machine and is supported by NetBSD/evbarm port.
